jasso.label: Japan Society for the Study of Obesity

kaup_diag.label: Infants (3 months+)
kaup_diag.formula: if(kaup>=15 and kaup<=18, 'Normal range', 'Outside normal range')

risk.label: Stroke Risk
risk.formula: iif(score==0, 'Low risk 1.0%/year', score==1, 'Low-mod risk 1.5%/year', score==2, 'Mod risk 2.5%/year', score==3, 'High risk 5.0%/year', 'Very high risk >7.0%/year')

score.label: Score
score.formula: heart_failure + hypertension + age_75*2 + diabetes + stroke*2 + vascular_disease + age_65_74 + (sex==0?1:0)

risk.label: Stroke Risk (%/year)
risk.formula: iif(score==0, '0 (Low risk)', score==1, '0.5-0.9 (Low risk)', score==2, '1.5-2.5 (Moderate risk)', score==3, '3-5 (High risk)', '>5 (Very high risk)')

score.label: Score
score.formula: heart_failure + hypertension + age_75*2 + diabetes + stroke*2 + vascular_disease + age_65_74

risk.label: Stroke Risk (%/year)
risk.formula: iif(score==0, '0 (Minimal risk)', score==1, '0.2 (Low risk)', score==2, '1.0 (Moderate risk)', score==3, '2.5 (High risk)', '>5 (Very high risk)')

abnormal_renal.label: Abnormal renal function (dialysis, transplant, Cr ≥2.26 mg/dL)

labile_inr.label: Labile INR (<60% time in therapeutic range)

score.label: HAS-BLED Score
score.formula: hypertension + abnormal_renal + abnormal_liver + stroke + bleeding_history + labile_inr + elderly + drugs_alcohol

interpretation.label: Interpretation
interpretation.text: Score ≥3: High bleeding risk (~3.74 events/100 patient-years); Requires regular review. Does NOT contraindicate anticoagulation.

warning.label: Caution
warning.text: If TG ≥400 mg/dL, measure LDL directly

note.label: Note
note.text: Valid for TG < 800 mg/dL; more accurate than Friedewald at low LDL-C and high TG

mortality.label: 3-Month Mortality Risk
mortality.formula: iif(meld_score < 9, '<1% (Low risk)', meld_score < 12, '1-5% (Low risk)', meld_score < 15, '6-27% (Intermediate risk)', meld_score < 20, '27-76% (High risk)', meld_score < 26, '76-85% (Very high risk)', '>87% (Extremely high risk)')

note.label: Note
note.text: Minimum values: Creatinine/Bilirubin/INR ≥1. Sodium range: 125-140 mEq/L for calculation. Dialysis: Cr ≥4 mg/dL.

interpretation.label: Interpretation
interpretation.formula: iif(total_score <= 6, 'Well-compensated cirrhosis', total_score <= 9, 'Significant functional impairment', 'Poorly compensated cirrhosis')

cystatin_c_age.name: eGFR from Cystatin C and Age (18+)

assert.message: Male (13-21 years) k value cannot be selected with Female sex

score.label: Score
score.formula: (sex ? age : age - 10) + nursing_home*10 + neoplastic*30 + liver*20 + congestive_hf*10 + cerebrovascular*10 + renal*10 + altered_mental*20 + pulse_gt_125*20 + rr_gt_30*20 + sbp_lt_90*15 + temp_abnormal*10 + ph_lt_7_35*30 + bun_ge_30*20 + na_lt_130*20 + glucose_ge_250*10 + hematocrit_lt_30*10 + pao2_lt_60*10 + pleural_effusion*10

class.label: Class
class.formula: CalculatePSIClass(age, altered_mental, pulse_gt_125, rr_gt_30, sbp_lt_90, temp_abnormal, neoplastic, congestive_hf, cerebrovascular, renal, liver, score)

judgment.label: Judgment
judgment.formula: iif(count==0, 'Outpatient', count<=2, 'Outpatient or Hospitalization', count==3, 'Hospitalization', 'ICU admission')

note.label: Note
note.text: If shock present, consider severe regardless of count

venous_to_arterial_blood_gas.name: Central Venous to Arterial Blood Gas

risk.label: Risk
risk.formula: iif(score>=6, 'High risk 8.1% stroke within 2 days', score>=4, 'Moderate risk 4.1% stroke within 2 days', 'Low risk 1.0% stroke within 2 days')

score.label: Score
score.formula: age + bp + clinical + duration + diabetes + dwi*2

risk.label: Risk
risk.formula: iif(score>=7, 'Very high risk', score>=5, 'High risk', score>=3, 'Moderate risk', 'Low risk')

note.label: Note
note.text: ABCD²-I adds DWI imaging to ABCD². Score range: 0-9. DWI lesion adds 2 points.

interpretation.label: Interpretation
interpretation.text: 13-15: Minor, 9-12: Moderate, 3-8: Severe (coma), 3: Deep coma/brain death

options.label: 3 - Complete paralysis of one or both sides
2 - Ataxia in two or more limbs
1 - Visual, tactile, auditory, spatial, or personal inattention

total.label: NIHSS Total Score
total.formula: loc + loc_questions + loc_commands + gaze + visual + facial_palsy + motor_arm_total + motor_leg_total + limb_ataxia + sensory + best_language + dysarthria + extinction_inattention

severity.label: Stroke Severity
severity.formula: iif(total==0, 'No stroke symptoms', total<=4, 'Minor stroke', total<=15, 'Moderate stroke', total<=20, 'Moderate to severe stroke', 'Severe stroke')

interpretation.label: Interpretation
interpretation.text: 0: No symptoms, 1-4: Minor stroke, 5-15: Moderate stroke, 16-20: Moderate to severe stroke, 21-42: Severe stroke

prognosis.label: Prognosis
prognosis.text: Higher scores correlate with larger infarct volume, worse outcomes, and higher mortality. Score ≥16 predicts high probability of death or severe disability.

jcs.name: Japan Coma Scale (JCS)
jcs.html:
I. Awake

  • 0 Fully alert
  • I-1 Not fully alert but responsive to call
  • I-2 Disoriented
  • I-3 Cannot state name or birthday

II. Responds to stimuli with transient awakening

  • II-10 Opens eyes to normal call
  • II-20 Opens eyes to loud call or shaking
  • II-30 Opens eyes only to pain + continuous calling

III. Does not respond even to stimuli

  • III-100 Avoids pain stimuli
  • III-200 Reacts to pain with movement or grimacing
  • III-300 No response to pain

pediatric_jcs.name: Pediatric Consciousness Level
pediatric_jcs.html:
I. Awake

  • 0 Fully alert
  • I-1 Smiles when soothed (but insufficient response)
  • I-2 Does not smile but makes eye contact
  • I-3 Does not make eye contact with mother

II. Awakens with stimuli (falls asleep when stimuli stop)

  • II-10 Tries to drink when shown beverage or sucks when shown nipple
  • II-20 Opens eyes and looks when called
  • II-30 Opens eyes only with repeated calling

III. Does not awaken even with stimuli

  • III-100 Avoids/brushes away pain stimuli
  • III-200 Moves limbs slightly or grimaces to pain
  • III-300 No response to pain

options.label: Dopamine >5 μg/kg/min or epinephrine ≤0.1 μg/kg/min or norepinephrine ≤0.1 μg/kg/min
Dopamine >15 μg/kg/min or epinephrine >0.1 μg/kg/min or norepinephrine >0.1 μg/kg/min

renal_score.label: Renal Score
renal_score.formula: iif(creatinine >= 5 or urine_output < 200, 4, creatinine >= 3.5 or urine_output < 500, 3, creatinine >= 2, 2, creatinine >= 1.2, 1, 0)

total.label: Total SOFA Score
total.formula: respiration_score + coagulation_score + liver_score + cardiovascular_score + cns_score + renal_score

interpretation.label: Interpretation
interpretation.text: ≥2: Indicates organ dysfunction; Score change ≥2 indicates significant change in organ function

interpretation.label: Interpretation
interpretation.text: Score ≥2: Associated with greater risk of poor outcome (mortality ≥10%); Prompt further evaluation and consider sepsis

note.label: Note
note.text: qSOFA is a bedside prompt for early identification of patients with suspected infection who are at greater risk for poor outcome outside the ICU
